intro: Elatostema lithoneurum, commonly known as the rock bladder, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds by wind. Elatostema lithoneurum typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
